revised_title: A Linear Associative Algebra for Electromagnetic Relations and Theory of Relativity
tldr: The authors introduce a linear associative algebra based on four fundamental units that can express the vector formulae of Minkowski and electromagnetic relations in a simple manner. They interpret the units as mutually rectangular unit vectors in four-dimensional space and demonstrate how this algebra can represent Maxwell's equations in the Hertz-Heaviside form. This work connects the theory of relativity with electromagnetic relations and provides a mathematical framework for further exploration.
